3.5. An approximation problem in the theory of Sobolev spaces
J.L. Lewis [43] showed that C∞(Ω) is dense in L1,p(Ω) if Ω is an arbitrary Jordan domain in the plane, i.e. ∂Ω is homeomorphic to ∂B1. In [44] he asked if C∞(Ω) is dense in Ll,p(Ω) with l > 1 for every Jordan domain Ω ⊂ R2.
It is almost obvious that L∞(Ω) ∩ L1,p(Ω) is dense in L1,p(Ω) for every open set Ω ⊂ Rn. A direct extension of this property for Ll,p(Ω) with l > 1 is impossible, as shown in [80]. A planar domain Ω in the counterexample proposed in [80] is not Jordan, which gives rise to the following
Problem. Are bounded functions belonging to Ll,p(Ω), l > 1, dense in Ll,p(Ω) if Ω is an arbitrary Jordan domain?
